List of all members.

Detailed Description

SCENE+ Generic Renderee.

Abstraction of an object capable to render using the IRndrGeneric generic renderer derivated object. Rendering in this context means not only displaying an object on screen, but also otherwise affecting the overall rendering process like in case of lights and cameras.

This interface is used as a base class by all the interfaces in the SCENE+ Module but itself has no implemenation.

Definition at line 128 of file sceneplus.idl.

Public Member Functions

Flag and Testing
HRESULT IsReady ()
 Returns S_OK if the object is initialised properly; S_FALSE otherwise.

HRESULT IsVisible ()
 Returns S_OK if the object is visible (switched on); S_FALSE otherwise.

HRESULT PutVisible (BOOL bOn)
 Switches the object visibility on or off.

HRESULT PutRenderHint (BOOL b)
 Hints if the object should be rendered or not; implementation may ignore this call (return S_FALSE then).

HRESULT NeedsRendering (BOOL bReset)
 The Master Render Flag: returns S_OK if all other flags and conditions are satisfied: both Ready and Visible flags must be set; RenderHint may be taken into account; further conditions depend on implemenation bReset is set to true after device reset, when objects are required to re-rendered if ready and visible.

HRESULT GetRenderOrdinal (FWULONG *)
 The ordinal number determining the sequence in which objects are rendered (see more on GetRenderOrdinal).

HRESULT PutRenderOrdinalOffset (FWULONG)
 An offset value to be added to the GetRenderOrdinal function.

Operations

 Renders the Renderee using the generic Renderer :-).

HRESULT Turnoff (IRndrGeneric *)
 Turns the Renderee off using the generic Renderer.

Member Function Documentation

HRESULT ISceneRenderee::GetRenderOrdinal (  FWULONG *   ) 
 

The ordinal number determining the sequence in which objects are rendered (see more on GetRenderOrdinal).

The IScene object keeps all renderees on a sorted Display List, and starts any rendering from those with lower valures of the Render Ordinal. The standard values are:

  • 20 for set-up objects (lights and cameras)
  • 200 for meshed objects Additionally, a user-specidfied offset (see PutRenderOrdinalOffset) may be added to the above. This value is rarely changed during the object life cycle. In case it is, call IScene::SortDisplayList() in order for these changes to succeed. Also, after a PutRenderOrdinalOffset call IScene::SortDisplayList() should be called.
